places.title: Castillo San Felipe del Morro - San Juan
places.description: Fort San Felipe del Morro â€”or El Castillo San Felipe del Morro in Spanishâ€” is a sixteenth-century citadel which lies on the northwestern-most point of the islet of San Juan, Puerto Rico. Named in honor of King Philip II of Spain, the fort, also referred to as "El Morro" or "promontory", was designed to guard the entrance to San Juan bay, and defend the city of San Juan from seaborne enemies. More Info
